title: Chess Basics Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of basic chess rules and concepts.

questions.text: Which piece can move in an L-shape?
questions.explanation: The Knight is the only chess piece that moves in an L-shape: two squares in one direction and then one square perpendicular to that direction.

questions.text: A pawn can move two squares forward on its first move.
questions.explanation: Pawns can move two squares forward from their starting position but only one square forward afterward.

questions.text: What is it called when the king is under attack?
questions.explanation: When the king is under attack, it is in 'check'. The player must move to eliminate the threat.

questions.text: White to move. What is the best move to checkmate Black?
questions.explanation: Qxf7# is checkmate. The queen captures the f7 pawn with check, and the king has no legal moves.

questions.text: How many squares are on a standard chess board?
questions.explanation: A standard chess board has 8×8 = 64 squares.
